location: Arugam Bay, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Arugam Bay, located in the Ampara District, is one of the most popular surf spots in Sri Lanka. Known for its perfect waves, especially between May and September, it attracts surfers from around the world. Beyond surfing, the bay offers beautiful, calm beaches ideal for relaxation, along with nearby wildlife sanctuaries like Kumana National Park, which adds to its appeal. The best time to visit Arugam Bay is during the dry season, from April to October, when the weather is ideal for beach activities. No tickets are required to access the beach, making it a free and accessible destination for all.

location: Kumana National Park, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Kumana National Park, situated in the southeast of the Ampara District, is renowned for its rich wildlife and bird-watching opportunities. The park is home to a variety of animals, including elephants, leopards, and crocodiles, but it is especially famous for its large number of migratory birds. From April to July, bird enthusiasts can spot rare species like the black-necked stork and painted stork, making it an ideal time to visit. The park's diverse ecosystem, which includes lagoons, mangroves, and grasslands, adds to its unique appeal. Tickets are required to enter the park, and guided safaris are available for a better experience of its natural beauty.

location: Gal Oya National Park, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Gal Oya National Park, located in the Ampara District, is famous for its stunning landscapes and the unique experience of boat safaris on the Senanayake Samudraya, Sri Lanka’s largest reservoir. Visitors can often spot elephants swimming between the islands, an extraordinary sight that sets this park apart. The park is home to leopards, sloth bears, and diverse bird species, making it a great spot for wildlife lovers. The best time to visit is from March to July when the water levels are perfect for boat safaris. Tickets are required, with prices around LKR 1,500 for locals and LKR 3,500 for foreigners, and guided tours are available for a more enriching experience.

location: Lahugala Magul Maha Viharaya, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Lahugala Magul Maha Viharaya, located in the Ampara District, is an ancient Buddhist temple with deep historical significance. The site is known for its serene atmosphere and beautiful ruins, including intricately carved stone structures. It is believed that the temple was built for the wedding of King Kavantissa and Queen Viharamahadevi, adding a touch of romance to its historical appeal. The surrounding Lahugala National Park also provides opportunities to see wildlife, especially elephants. The best time to visit is during the dry season, from May to September, when the weather is pleasant for both exploring the temple and nearby nature. .

location: Crocodile Rock, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Crocodile Rock, located near Arugam Bay in the Ampara District, is a scenic viewpoint known for its breathtaking panoramic views and the chance to spot wildlife, especially crocodiles, sunbathing by the lagoon. The rock itself offers a short, adventurous hike, rewarding visitors with a peaceful spot to take in the surrounding landscapes. It's a great place for nature lovers and photographers. The best time to visit is early morning or late afternoon, especially between April and October, when the weather is pleasant, and wildlife is more active.

location: Pottuvil Lagoon, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Lahugala Kithulana National Park, located in the Ampara District, is a small but significant wildlife sanctuary known for its large elephant population. The park's natural beauty is enhanced by its three reservoirs, which attract herds of elephants during the dry season, making it an ideal spot for wildlife viewing. Birdwatchers will also enjoy the variety of species that visit the park’s wetlands. The best time to visit is from June to September, when elephants are more easily spotted near the water sources. Tickets are required for entry, with prices around LKR 1,000 for locals and LKR 3,000 for foreigners, and guided safaris offer a more immersive experience of the park's natural beauty.

location: Pottuvil Point, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Pottuvil Point, located near Arugam Bay in the Ampara District, is a peaceful and less crowded surfing spot that offers some of the best waves for surfers, especially during the surf season from May to September. The area is also known for its quiet, unspoiled beaches, making it a great place for relaxation and enjoying nature. The calm waters and stunning sunsets make it popular among visitors looking for a serene beach experience.

location: Maha Oya Hot Water Springs, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Maha Oya Hot Water Springs, situated in the Ampara District, is a unique natural attraction known for its therapeutic hot springs. The springs are believed to have healing properties and provide a relaxing experience amid the lush greenery. Visitors can enjoy soaking in the warm waters while taking in the tranquil surroundings. The best time to visit is during the dry season, from May to September, when the weather is pleasant. No tickets are required to access the hot water springs.

location: Deeghawapi Raja Maha Viharaya, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Deeghawapi Raja Maha Viharaya, located in the Ampara District, is an ancient Buddhist temple known for its impressive stupa and historical significance. The temple is revered for its role in preserving Sri Lankan Buddhism and is a serene place for meditation and reflection. The stupa, believed to contain relics of the Buddha, is a major attraction and draws both devotees and history enthusiasts. The best time to visit is during the dry season, from May to September, when the weather is favorable for exploring the site. No tickets are required to visit the temple.

location: Oluvil Lighthouse, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Oluvil Lighthouse, situated in the Ampara District, is a prominent coastal landmark guiding ships safely through the area. This historic lighthouse offers stunning views of the Indian Ocean and the surrounding coastline. The nearby area is also known for its beautiful beaches and serene environment, making it a nice spot for a scenic visit. The best time to visit is during the dry season from May to September when the weather is ideal for exploring and enjoying the views.

location: Senanayake Samudraya, Eastern Province, Sri Lanka
description: Senanayake Samudraya, located in the Ampara District, is Sri Lanka's largest reservoir, renowned for its picturesque landscapes and recreational opportunities. The reservoir offers a serene environment for boat rides, where visitors can often spot elephants and other wildlife along the shores. It's also a popular spot for birdwatching, especially during the migration seasons. The best time to visit is from March to July, when the weather is pleasant and the water levels are ideal for boating.
